Docs.summary: Value for and indicating that the screen or button backlight brightness should be set to the hightest value when this window is in front.

Docs.summary: This can be used to override the standard behavior of the button and keyboard backlights.

remarks.para: This can be used to override the standard behavior of the button and keyboard backlights. A value of less than 0, the default, means to use the standard backlight behavior. 0 to 1 adjusts the brightness from dark to full bright.

Docs.summary: Start of window types that represent normal application windows.

remarks.para: Start of window types that represent normal application windows.

Docs.summary: Start of types of sub-windows.

remarks.para: Start of types of sub-windows. The of these windows must be set to the window they are attached to. These types of windows are kept next to their attached window in Z-order, and their coordinate space is relative to their attached window.

Docs.summary: Start of system-specific window types.

remarks.para: Start of system-specific window types. These are not normally created by applications.

remarks.para: Various behavioral options/flags. Default is none.

Docs.summary: Indicates how much of the extra space will be allocated horizontally to the view associated with these LayoutParams.

remarks.para: Indicates how much of the extra space will be allocated horizontally to the view associated with these LayoutParams. Specify 0 if the view should not be stretched. Otherwise the extra pixels will be pro-rated among all views whose weight is greater than 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool MayUseInputMethod(valuetype Android.Views.WindowManagerFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.summary: Given a particular set of window manager flags, determine whether such a window may be a target for an input method when it has focus.

remarks.para: Given a particular set of window manager flags, determine whether such a window may be a target for an input method when it has focus. In particular, this checks the and flags and returns true if the combination of the two corresponds to a window that needs to be behind the input method so that the user can type into it.

Docs.summary: Define the exit and entry animations used on this window when the device is rotated.

remarks.para: Define the exit and entry animations used on this window when the device is rotated. This only has an affect if the incoming and outgoing topmost opaque windows have the #FLAG_FULLSCREEN bit set and are not covered by other windows. All other situations default to the behavior.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Identifier for this window.

remarks.para: Identifier for this window. This will usually be filled in for you.

Docs.summary: The general type of window.

remarks.para:
The general type of window. There are three main classes of window types:
Application windows (ranging from to ) are normal top-level application windows. For these types of windows, the must be set to the token of the activity they are a part of (this will normally be done for you if is null).
Sub-windows (ranging from to ) are associated with another top-level window. For these types of windows, the must be the token of the window it is attached to.
System windows (ranging from to ) are special types of windows for use by the system for specific purposes. They should not normally be used by applications, and a special permission is required to use them.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.WindowManagerEventType TypeChanged = (2)

Docs.summary: Indicates how much of the extra space will be allocated vertically to the view associated with these LayoutParams.

remarks.para: Indicates how much of the extra space will be allocated vertically to the view associated with these LayoutParams. Specify 0 if the view should not be stretched. Otherwise the extra pixels will be pro-rated among all views whose weight is greater than 0.

Docs.summary: A style resource defining the animations to use for this window.

remarks.para: A style resource defining the animations to use for this window. This must be a system resource; it can not be an application resource because the window manager does not have access to applications.
